title.narrative: National Interfaith Peacebuilding Initiative in Tanzania

description.narrative: In 2012-2014 a number of violent events have occurred in Tanzania. These include attacks on churches and mosques, acid attacks on religious leaders and the killing of a catholic priest. Although it is widely acknowledged that some of these events are more rooted in political discourses, Tanzania runs the risk of losing its reputation as a place of interreligious tolerance. The overall mission of this project is to contribute to building sustainable and durable peace in Tanzania. Furthermore, the project aims to address the challenges of division and escalating violence by building the capacity of religious leaders and by strengthening the intra- and inter-religious relations in Tanzania. This project aims to obtain the specific objectives: 1.Promote intra-faith relations enabling Muslims and Christians to establish common ground on cooperation for peace and development. 2.Promote interfaith relations enabling key religious leaders to engage in joint action for peace and development 3.Increase public awareness and deepen impact of the national conference in Tanzania.
